thread.title: Ambridge Area High School interim assistant principal resigns
thread.title_full: Ambridge Area High School interim assistant principal resigns

author: Katherine Schaeffer kschaeffer@timesonline.com
title: Ambridge Area High School interim assistant principal resigns
text:
AMBRIDGE — Ambridge Area School District’s board of directors voted Wednesday evening to accept high school interim assistant principal Kiara Higgins' resignation. 
Higgins’ resignation is retroactively effective from Sept. 29. 
The board voted to hire Higgins, the former Woodland Hills High School Spanish teacher, at their Sept. 16 meeting. 
This makes Higgins' resignation her second in less than a year. Higgins stepped down from her position at Woodland Hills on Feb. 24, about a month after Woodland Hills police found her in a parked car with a student at night, according to the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette. 
Higgins submitted a resignation letter to Ambridge Area's board in mid-September, district solicitor Hobart Webster said. 
The district hired Higgins on the condition that her background check and other clearances came back clean, Webster said. She submitted her resignation before the board would have been able to take action on any results, he said. 
The board does not currently have any interviews scheduled for Higgins’ position, he said. 
The board also voted Wednesday to appoint Mariah Passarelli, of Esquire and Buchanan, Ingersoll & Rooney PC, to investigate a district personnel issue. 
“The district takes every complaint seriously,” Webster said, although he could not comment on the nature of the investigation or the parties involved. Tags
